name: Competitive Intelligence Report
description: Research and synthesize competitive intelligence on key competitors. Includes tracking product launches, pricing changes, market positioning, leadership moves, and strategic shifts. Produces actionable insights for leadership decision-making.

currentProcess.description: Define scope: which competitors, what aspects to track
painPoints: Hard to prioritize which competitors matter most

currentProcess.description: Manual research: news, press releases, social media, job postings
painPoints: Missing important updates buried in obscure sources

currentProcess.description: Analyze competitor websites for product/pricing changes
Synthesize findings into themes and implications

painPoints: Making recommendations specific enough to act on

aiProcess.toolRationale: Perplexity provides real-time web search with citations - critical for competitive intel
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Structured findings by competitor with source URLs
tips: Run separate queries for each competitor
Search for '[company] news last 30 days' and '[company] product launch 2026'
Save the sources - you'll need them for credibility

aiProcess.toolRationale: Claude excels at pattern recognition and strategic synthesis across multiple data points
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Categorized findings (product, pricing, strategy, people) with strategic implications
tips: Provide all raw research from Step 1
Ask for both 'what happened' and 'what it means for us'

aiProcess.toolRationale: Claude can reason about competitive dynamics and generate strategic recommendations
tips: Provide your company's current strategy for context
Ask for recommendations ranging from 'monitor' to 'respond immediately'

aiProcess.toolRationale: ChatGPT writes clear, professional reports quickly
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Draft report with executive summary, competitor profiles, and recommendations

aiProcess.toolRationale: Human review critical for accuracy; AI assists with polishing
tips: Verify all claims against source URLs
Flag anything that needs further investigation

whyItMatters: Competitive intelligence drives strategic decision-making. Missing a competitor's move can mean lost market share, pricing disadvantage, or strategic surprise. Fast, accurate intel enables proactive rather than reactive strategy.
commonMistakes: Reporting what competitors did without explaining what it means for you
Including too much noise - every press release isn't strategic
Not citing sources - reduces credibility with leadership
Confusing competitor PR spin with actual strategy
Making recommendations without considering your own capacity to respond
tips: Set up Google Alerts for competitors to capture news between reports
Track competitor job postings - they reveal strategic priorities
Use LinkedIn to monitor leadership changes and new hires
Ask AI to 'think like competitor X' - what would their next move be?
Keep a running doc so monthly reports build on each other
sources: McKinsey Strategy Practice - Competitive analysis frameworks
BCG Henderson Institute - Competitive monitoring best practices
